title: WPP boss cautious despite surprise return to growth
text:
The boss of WPP has sounded a note of caution over the advertising giant’s return to growth in the third quarter, predicting that sales will slip in the last three months of the year.

Chief executive Mark Read, who took on the top job over a year ago following the acrimonious departure of Sir Martin Sorrell, called Friday's results “encouraging” and a step in its aim to return to sustainable growth by 2021, but that comparatives with the fourth quarter of 2018 will be difficult.

“The expectation is to decline in [the fourth quarter],” he said.

WPP generated an unexpected rise in organic growth of 0.7pc for the three months to September - easily beating analysts' forecasts of a 0.6pc decline...
